isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1995) - ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS - CIRCUIT FUNCTION AND DIAGNOSTICS - ELECTRONIC CONTROL MODULE SELF DIAGNOSTICS (ECM)

svcsubproc.title: SIGNAL FUNCTIONS
svcsubproc.para: The Electronic Control Module (ECM) monitors and controls engine operation and performance, vehicle features such as PTO and cruise control, communicates information to the Vehicle Personality Module (VPM) and Injector Drive Module (IDM).

svcsubproc.title: FAULT DETECTION/MANAGEMENT
svcsubproc.para: The ECM is capable of internal fault detection and dependent upon the severity of the problem, can provide fault management strategies to allow limited engine/vehicle operation.

svcsubproc.title: NORMAL OPERATION DIAGNOSTICS
svcsubproc.para: During normal engine operation, the ECM automatically performs several tests to detect faults. During Normal Operation, the ECM performs the Start-up KAM Test and Continuous Diagnostics.

svcsubproc.title: START-UP KAM TEST
svcsubproc.para: The Start-up KAM Test is used to validate the ECM's Keep-Alive-Memory once each time the ECM resets (turns ON). If an error is detected, Flash codes 224 or 615 can be set.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 615

para.title: ECM: Programmable Parameter KAM Corrupt Fault

svcsubproc.para: Flash Code 615 can be set when Flash code 224 is set. If 224 is present, refer to Section F to diagnose.
If code 224 IS NOT SET, code 615 indicates that the ECM's RAM is defective. Replace the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Continuous Diagnostics
svcsubproc.para: Continuous diagnostic checks are made by the ECM during vehicle operation to detect out-of-range, rationality and system faults. Flash codes 112 and 113 can be set during this diagnostic process. Refer to (ECM PWR) in this section.

svcsubproc.title: ON DEMAND DIAGNOSTICS (Service Diagnostics)
svcsubproc.para: The ECM will perform On-Demand Diagnostics (Service diagnostics) when requested by the service technician. The KOEO Standard Test Procedure includes:

svcsubproc.title: ECM Internal Self-Tests
svcsubproc.para: Use the Prolink EST to perform the self-tests. The test procedure checks the ECM's CPU, RAM, and ROM. The test may set the following flash codes.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 111
svcsubproc.para: Flash Code 111 indicates that the ECM has not detected any errors.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 625
svcsubproc.para: Code 625 indicates that the ECM Software is Faulty. Replace the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 631
svcsubproc.para: If code 631 is present, replace the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 632
svcsubproc.para: If code 632 is present, replace the ECM.
During the OCC checks, the following ECM related codes can occur:

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 254
svcsubproc.para: If code 254 is present, replace the ECM.

svcsubproc.title: Flash Code 255
svcsubproc.para: If code 255 is present, replace the ECM.
